full_text: Roles and permissions control user access to user interface components and functionality in PolicyCenter. We will log into PolicyCenter as several users with different permissions, to see how permissions influence access to PolicyCenter and the ability to see and do things. First, login is Rick Ralston, who has the underwriting supervisor role. On the desktop, there are many menu links on the left navigation menu. There is also a team tab on the tab bar. Logout. Logout. Login is Alice Applegate, who has the underwriter and reinsurance manager role. Notice the team tab is not displayed, since the underwriter role does not have the view team permission. Logout. Login as external admin, who has the user admin role. It only has the My Activities link on the left menu. It does not have the account tab on the tab tab. Logout. Logout. Login as superuser to manage the roles and permissions. The roles are managed on the Administration page. Select Users and Security, roles. A role is a name collection of permissions, and typically maps to a job title or a job function. Let's create a new role. Type in the name. Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy of Filogy Select the desired permission. Determine what the actions that the users with this role can perform, such as view, edit, etc. and those permissions to the role. A permission can also be removed from the role. Here are just some examples. Click Update to save the role. Open the Producer role. The role can be edited. Go to the Users tab. Policy Center lists the users, whom have this role assigned to them. You must go to the user to assign roles to the user. Go to the Roles tab. Edit the user. You can add a new role to the user. Or select a role. The Remove button is available now. Let's cancel the edit. A user has all the permissions of the roles assigned, cumulatively. This is the end of demonstration for roles and permissions.

segments.text: Roles and permissions control user access to user interface components and functionality in PolicyCenter. We will log into PolicyCenter as several users with different permissions, to see how permissions influence access to PolicyCenter and the ability to see and do things. First, login is Rick Ralston, who has the underwriting supervisor role. On the desktop, there are many menu links on the left navigation menu. There is also a team tab on the tab bar.

Logout. Logout. Login is Alice Applegate, who has the underwriter and reinsurance manager role. Notice the team tab is not displayed, since the underwriter role does not have the view team permission. Logout. Login as external admin, who has the user admin role. It only has the My Activities link on the left menu. It does not have the account tab on the tab tab.

Logout. Logout. Login as superuser to manage the roles and permissions. The roles are managed on the Administration page. Select Users and Security, roles. A role is a name collection of permissions, and typically maps to a job title or a job function. Let's create a new role. Type in the name.

Select the desired permission.
Determine what the actions that the users with this role can perform, such as view, edit, etc. and those permissions to the role.
A permission can also be removed from the role.
Here are just some examples.
Click Update to save the role.
Open the Producer role.
The role can be edited.
Go to the Users tab.
Policy Center lists the users, whom have this role assigned to them.
You must go to the user to assign roles to the user.
Go to the Roles tab.
Edit the user.
You can add a new role to the user.
Or select a role.
The Remove button is available now.
Let's cancel the edit.
A user has all the permissions of the roles assigned, cumulatively.
This is the end of demonstration for roles and permissions.
